description.narrative: CISCOPE will be supporting Oxfam in the proposed intervention which is a follow-up to Oxfam ongoing Humanitarian Response in North East Nigeria and scale up of its scope to meet the increasing humanitarian needs in the region. The analysis of the currentimpact ofthe counter-insurgency revealed IDPs numbers increasing to approximately 2.1 Million persons in Maiduguri due to returnees from Cameroon and neighboring States. In addition, tens of thousands are also returning to their area of origin in AdamawaNorth where insurgency and counter insurgency as resulted in mass destruction of facilities, infrastructures, shelters and livelihood. In addressing the situation, Oxfam and its partners will intervene in Adamawa and Borno States in North Eastern Nigeriaand will prioritize WASH andFood Security activities to prevent waterborne related diseases for IDPs and host families and mitigate the impact of food insecurity to save lives and build the resilience of host communities whose resources have been stretched by the crises. The WASH intervention will be a blanket coverage ensuring access to water, hygiene promotion and sanitation facilities. The intervention will employ immediate support for food and livelihoods through agriculture support for most vulnerable women to improve their coping capacity. Protection mainstreaming combined with advocacy will assist in ensuring the dignity and respect of human rights for the most vulnerablewomen, girls, boys and men and access to impartial and appropriate and genderresponsive humanitarian assistance. This project make part of the Lake Chad Basin crisis response.

participating-org.narrative: Civil Society Coalition for Poverty Eradication (CISCOPE) is a coalition grouping of over 130 Nigerian Civil Society Organizations.There are at least three civil society member organizations of CISCOPE in each state of the federation. Founded in 2002, CISCOPE was formed in response to the need for a national platform for organizing Civil Society input into the Nigerian Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP). It was also a response to the belief at the time that individual Nigerian NGOs did not have sufficient capacity to undertake meaningful development and humanitarian work, and that by pooling their resources together they were in a better position to make qualitative contributions in national topical discussions that will enhance the livelihood of the poor and vulnerable in the society as well as respond to the needs of victims of humanitarian disasters. Driven by the vision of poverty # free Nigerian Society, CISCOPE strives to facilitate civil society participation in public processes and influence them in favour of the poor and marginalized. In this regard, CISCOPE engages all levels of government (federal, state and local) as well as institutions for policy and decision - making on vital social sector services such as education, health, agriculture, Emergency Food Security and Livelivelihood etc.
